definition: Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell

sentences.english: Cannot drink, wang and Xie Sixiao that would compete with drinks the great s.
sentences.chinese: 不能喝酒，王星和谢思潇这对冤家就用饮料比拼。

sentences.english: A suggestion-enabled search is like an instant popularity contest.
sentences.chinese: 为搜索提供建议，这好比是即时的“流行度大比拼”。

sentences.english: Gateball is a sport with strong strategic elements and stimulates intellectual engagement .
sentences.chinese: 门球是带有较强的战术成分的运动，它激发智慧比拼。

sentences.english: Believe me, I can’t compete with Jewish moms.
sentences.chinese: 不骗你，我绝对不会跟犹太妈妈们比拼。

definition: to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
lit. unable to distinguish eldest brother from second brother (idiom); they are all equally excellent/nothing to choose between them
victory or defeat/the outcome of a battle
to fight over/to contest/to vie over
to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell
to compare notes/to learn from one another/to swap pointers
